articles.description: During oral arguments, both conservative and liberal justices expressed concerns about allowing individual states to disqualify presidential candidates under the 14th Amendment's insurrection clause, suggesting they may overturn Colorado's decision to remove Trump from the primary ballot.

articles.title: US Strikes Iranian-Backed Targets in Syria and Iraq
articles.description: The US military conducted retaliatory airstrikes against Iran-backed militants in Iraq and Syria, targeting more than 85 locations in response to a drone attack that killed three American soldiers in Jordan last month.

articles.title: King Charles III Diagnosed with Cancer
articles.description: Buckingham Palace announced that King Charles III has been diagnosed with cancer discovered during his recent prostate treatment. While the specific type wasn't disclosed, the Palace stated the King has begun regular treatments and remains optimistic.

articles.title: US strikes Iranian nuclear sites as Israel-Iran conflict escalates
articles.description: The United States has launched strikes on Iranian nuclear research facilities, escalating the ongoing conflict between Israel and Iran. This intervention has drawn widespread international reactions and warnings of further consequences.
articles.source: Al Jazeera, AP News, Fox News, Google News

articles.title: Air India Plane Crash in Ahmedabad Kills Over 200
articles.description: An Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner crashed shortly after takeoff from Ahmedabad airport, resulting in the deaths of 241 people on board and 29 on the ground. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has directed Air India to remove three senior officials related to crew scheduling and rostering following the incident.
articles.source: The Hindu, The Times of India

articles.title: FedEx Founder Fred Smith Dies at 80
articles.description: Fred Smith, the visionary founder of FedEx who revolutionized package delivery, has passed away at the age of 80. A Marine Corps veteran, Smith's innovative approach transformed the logistics industry.
articles.source: Google News, AP News, Fox News

articles.title: US claims strikes on Iran nuclear sites caused 'severe damage,' but full impact is unclear.
articles.description: The United States has reportedly launched coordinated strikes on three key nuclear sites in Iran under "Operation Midnight Hammer," with President Donald Trump stating the facilities were "totally obliterated." While the US claims severe damage, the full extent of the impact on Iran's nuclear program remains unclear, and the strikes have significantly escalated tensions in the region.
articles.source: Associated Press News / CBS News / PMF IAS

articles.title: Iranian missiles slam into Israel as huge explosions rock Tehran.
articles.description: Following the U.S. strikes on its nuclear facilities, Iran retaliated by firing missiles at Israel, with reports of huge explosions rocking Tehran. Israeli medics indicated that more than 20 people were wounded in Israel due to the Iranian missile attacks.

articles.title: PM Modi calls for 'immediate de-escalation' after the U.S. bombs nuclear sites in Iran; UN chief warns of cycle of retaliation.
articles.description: In response to the escalating conflict, Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has called for "immediate de-escalation" after the U.S. bombed nuclear sites in Iran. Concurrently, United Nations chief Antonio Guterres warned against "another cycle of destruction" and retaliation, describing the U.S. strikes as a "perilous turn" in the Middle East.

articles.title: Trump says Israel-Iran ceasefire is in effect after deal initially faltered
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced that a ceasefire between Iran and Israel was in effect, despite initial faltering and his expressed frustration with both sides. This comes after Iran launched missiles at a U.S. base in the Middle East in retaliation for strikes on its nuclear facilities.

articles.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to restart swift deportation of migrants away from their home countries
articles.description: The Supreme Court has allowed the Trump administration to resume the swift deportation of migrants to countries other than their own, a decision that has drawn criticism and legal challenges.

articles.title: Iran attacks US air base in Qatar: What we know so far
articles.description: Iran launched ballistic missiles at the Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar, the largest U.S. military installation in the Middle East, in response to earlier Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. This event was a key part of the escalating conflict before the announced ceasefire.

articles.title: Fragile ceasefire appears to hold between Iran and Israel as Trump vents frustration with both sides
articles.description: A fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel seems to be holding, despite initial faltering, with U.S. President Donald Trump expressing his frustration with both nations for their prolonged conflict.

articles.title: Early US intelligence report suggests US strikes only set back Iran's nuclear program by months
articles.description: An early U.S. intelligence report indicates that recent American strikes on Iran's nuclear sites have only set back their program by a few months, rather than destroying it, a finding that contradicts earlier claims.

articles.title: 4 family members celebrating a birthday are among 8 dead from a boat capsize on Lake Tahoe
articles.description: Eight people have died, including four family members celebrating a birthday, after a boat capsized on Lake Tahoe during a sudden storm.

articles.title: Iran's supreme leader warns against further American attacks in his first statement since ceasefire
articles.description: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei stated that his country delivered a "slap to America's face" with its strike on an American base in Qatar and issued a warning against any further U.S. attacks. This was his first public comment since a ceasefire was declared with Israel after 12 days of conflict.

articles.title: Where Is Khamenei? Iran's Supreme Leader Missing Amid Ceasefire And Crisis
articles.description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's Supreme Leader, has been absent from public view for nearly a week, raising alarm and widespread concern amidst the ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump between Israel and Iran. Despite celebrations in Tehran, Khamenei has not addressed his countrymen, with reports suggesting he is in a secure underground bunker to avoid assassination attempts.

articles.title: Cooper Flagg taken by the Dallas Mavericks with the No. 1 pick in the NBA draft
articles.description: Cooper Flagg, the Duke forward and college player of the year, was selected as the No. 1 pick in the NBA draft by the Dallas Mavericks. This pick comes less than five months after the Mavericks traded Luka Doncic, and fans are hopeful Flagg will become the team's next franchise superstar.

articles.title: Supreme Court curbs injunctions that blocked Trump's birthright citizenship plan.
articles.description: The Supreme Court has limited injunctions that previously blocked former President Trump's birthright citizenship plan.

articles.title: Israel kills 72 in latest Gaza strikes as 549 aid seekers killed in a month.
articles.description: In the past 24 hours, 72 Palestinians were killed in Gaza, bringing the total to 549 aid seekers killed in a month due to Israeli strikes.

articles.title: Trump says US has signed a deal with China on trade, without giving details.
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump announced that the U.S. has signed a trade deal with China, though no specific details were provided.

articles.title: 'Mounting misery': Israeli attacks on Gaza kill 81 Palestinians in 24 hours
articles.description: Israeli attacks on Gaza have resulted in the deaths of 81 Palestinians within 24 hours, with an Israeli attack on al-Tuffah claiming 20 lives. The situation is described as "mounting misery" amidst ongoing conflict.

articles.title: Iran holds state funeral for top commanders, scientists killed by Israel
articles.description: Thousands of mourners gathered in Tehran for the state funeral of top Iranian military commanders and scientists who were killed in recent Israeli strikes. This event follows a 12-day conflict with Israel.

articles.title: Supreme Court limits nationwide injunctions, but fate of Trump birthright citizenship order unclear
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has limited the use of nationwide injunctions, ruling that lower courts' universal injunctions likely exceed their granted authority. This decision has implications for various executive actions, including former President Trump's birthright citizenship order, though its ultimate fate remains unclear.

articles.title: Supreme Court Clears Path for Trump to End Birthright Citizenship
articles.description: The Supreme Court has strengthened presidential powers, allowing President Trump to move forward with plans to end birthright citizenship, a decision hailed by Trump as a "monumental victory for the Constitution." This ruling limits the ability of federal judges to issue nationwide injunctions against presidential policies.

articles.title: Iran-Israel Ceasefire Holds Amid Funerals for Commanders and Scientists
articles.description: A fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel remains in place following a 12-day conflict. Thousands gathered in Tehran for the funerals of top Iranian military commanders and nuclear scientists killed during the war, with mourners cursing Israel and the United States. President Trump has warned Iran that the U.S. could strike again if uranium enrichment resumes.
articles.source: PBS News Weekend / ABC World News Tonight

articles.title: Top CDC Vaccine Expert Resigns in Protest Over Changing Vaccine Recommendations
articles.description: A leading vaccine expert at the CDC, Dr. Fiona Havers, resigned in protest after Secretary Kennedy fired the entire vaccine advisory panel and appointed new members, some of whom have expressed skepticism about certain vaccines. Dr. Havers expressed fears that these changing recommendations could cost lives.

articles.title: Gunman started Idaho blaze and then fatally shot 2 firefighters in ambush attack, officials say
articles.description: Two firefighters were killed and another wounded in an ambush attack while responding to a brush fire in Idaho; the suspected gunman was later found dead on a mountain. [2, 3, 4, 5, 8, 12, 13]

articles.title: Senate Set To Kick Off Voting On Trump's Big Beautiful Bill: Live Updates
articles.description: The U.S. Senate is debating and voting on President Trump's "Big, Beautiful Bill," a legislative package that includes significant tax cuts and program changes, with a key Republican senator announcing retirement after opposing it. [2, 4, 5, 7, 10, 12, 13]

articles.title: Canada rescinds digital services tax after Trump suspends trade talks
articles.description: Canada has withdrawn its digital services tax on U.S. technology companies, a decision made after President Trump announced he was suspending trade talks with the country. [2, 3, 5, 12, 13]

articles.title: Gaza babies face starvation as Israel blocks entry of baby formula
articles.description: Babies in Gaza are facing starvation as Israel continues to block the entry of baby formula, according to reports. [15]

articles.title: US Senate's vote-a-rama on Trump's 'Big, Beautiful Bill' continues
articles.description: The US Senate is continuing its 'vote-a-rama' session to push President Donald Trump's massive budget bill toward passage, despite concerns from some Republicans over proposed cuts to Medicaid. [10, 15] Elon Musk has also criticized the bill, calling for a new political party. [15]

articles.title: Death toll in Telangana pharma factory blast rises to 36
articles.description: The death toll from a blast in a reactor unit at Sigachi Industries Private Limited in the Pashamylaram industrial area near Hyderabad has risen to 36. [1] The incident occurred on Monday, June 30, 2025, with 13 others rescued from under the debris and several suffering critical burn injuries. [9]

articles.title: Hamas says ready for ceasefire but wants a complete end to the Gaza war
articles.description: Hamas has indicated its openness to a ceasefire agreement with Israel but insists that any deal must bring a complete end to the war in Gaza. This comes after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a U.S.-backed proposal for a 60-day ceasefire. [1, 14]

articles.title: US Senate passes Trump's landmark mega-bill
articles.description: The U.S. Senate has narrowly approved former President Trump's sweeping tax and spending legislation after a marathon 24-hour session. The bill, described as a 'big beautiful bill,' still needs to clear major hurdles in the House of Representatives before it can become law. [4, 5, 8, 11]

articles.title: Telangana pharma factory blast: One more body recovered from site, death toll rises to 37
articles.description: The death toll from the explosion at the Sigachi Industries blast site in Pashamylaram, Telangana, has risen to 37 after another body was recovered. The company has informed the National Stock Exchange (NSE) that 40 of its workers were killed in the incident. [1]

articles.title: Senate Narrowly Approves Massive Bill to Gut Social Programs and Cut Taxes on the Rich
articles.description: The United States Senate has approved a sweeping package of tax breaks for the wealthy and deep cuts to social programs, including Medicaid and food assistance. Vice President JD Vance cast the tie-breaking vote to deliver a major legislative victory to President Trump. The bill also includes a historic increase in funds for mass deportation efforts, deregulation of AI and cryptocurrency industries, and new taxes on solar and wind farms. The House is rushing to vote on the Senate-approved version of the bill ahead of a Trump-imposed July 4 deadline. [1, 3, 7, 11, 15, 17, 18]

articles.title: At least 118 people killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza in past 24 hours; Trump claims Israel agreed to 60-day ceasefire
articles.description: At least 118 people have been killed in Israeli attacks on Gaza in the past 24 hours, and Gaza's largest hospital, Al-Shifa, has exhausted its fuel supplies for operations.

articles.title: Death toll in central Texas flash floods rises to 82 as sheriff says 10 campers remain missing
articles.description: Catastrophic flash floods in central Texas have led to a soaring death toll, now at least 82, with dozens more missing, including 10 young girls from a Christian summer camp. Search and rescue operations are ongoing amidst devastated landscapes of mangled trees, overturned cars, and muck-filled debris. Authorities are facing questions regarding the lack of evacuation warnings despite severe weather forecasts. [7, 14]

articles.title: Israel, Hamas to hold Gaza truce talks as Netanyahu due to meet Trump
articles.description: Efforts for a Gaza ceasefire are gaining momentum, with Israel sending a negotiating team to Qatar for talks with Hamas. This comes as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is set to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump in Washington to discuss a potential deal. The proposed agreement aims for a 60-day pause in fighting and the release of at least 10 living hostages. [7, 9, 12]

articles.title: Musk says he's forming a new political party after split with Trump over tax cuts law
articles.description: Billionaire Elon Musk has announced the formation of a new political party called the 'American Party,' following a reported fallout with President Donald Trump over his administration's tax cuts law. This development comes amidst Trump's warnings of new tariffs on several countries, with letters explaining the new rates expected to be sent out. [4, 12, 14, 16]

articles.title: More than a 100 dead in Texas flash floods as search for missing continues
articles.description: The death toll in the devastating flash floods in central Texas has risen to 104 people, with search and recovery efforts continuing across several counties. The floods, which occurred over the Fourth of July weekend, have left many missing, including several girls attending a summer camp.

articles.title: Trump announces 25% tariffs on goods from Japan, South Korea in letters to leaders
articles.description: President Donald Trump has begun informing trade partners, including Japan and South Korea, that sharply higher U.S. tariffs of 25% will commence on August 1. Letters sent to 14 countries hinted at opportunities for additional negotiations while warning that any reprisal steps would be met with further escalation.

articles.title: Vadodara bridge collapse: Death toll rises to 15 as search continues
articles.description: The number of fatalities in the Vadodara bridge collapse climbed to 15 on Thursday (July 10, 2025), following the recovery of four more bodies. The incident occurred after a section of the Gambhira bridge in Gujarat's Vadodara district collapsed early on Wednesday (July 9, 2025), sending multiple vehicles crashing into the Mahisagar river below.

articles.title: Texas Flood Death Toll Reaches 121; 160 People Still Missing
articles.description: One week after historic flash floods devastated Texas, the death toll has risen to at least 121, with over 160 people still unaccounted for. President Trump visited the flood-ravaged central Texas to survey the damage and meet with first responders and local officials. [1, 7]

articles.title: Air India crash report shows confusion between pilots after fuel cutoff
articles.description: A preliminary investigation report into the Air India plane crash that killed at least 260 people revealed that the engines' fuel switches were moved from 'run' to 'cutoff' moments before impact, leading to confusion between the pilots. [13, 17, 18]

articles.title: Israel's minister celebrates destruction as more Gaza aid seekers killed
articles.description: The UN Human Rights Office has documented the killing of nearly 800 Palestinians seeking aid by Israeli forces in Gaza, many at US-Israeli run aid points. An Israeli attack also killed at least 16 Palestinians, including 8 children, who were waiting to receive nutritional supplements. [1, 5]

articles.title: Trump announces 30% tariffs against EU, Mexico to begin August 1
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced Saturday that he is levying tariffs of 30% against the European Union and Mexico, two of the United States' biggest trade partners. [2]

articles.title: Air India Crash: 'Both Engines Shut Down Shortly After Take Off' â AAIB Releases Preliminary Report Detailing Harrowing Final Moments
articles.description: A preliminary report on the recent Air India plane crash indicates that the fuel supply to both engines was cut off shortly after takeoff, leading to the fatal incident that killed 260 people. [5, 14]

articles.title: FEMA missed major flood risks at Camp Mystic where dozens died in the Texas floods, new analysis reveals
articles.description: A new analysis has revealed that FEMA missed major flood risks at Camp Mystic in Texas, where dozens died during the recent catastrophic Fourth of July flash floods. [10, 11, 12]

articles.title: Suspect kills 2 women in Kentucky church after shooting state trooper, police say
articles.description: Two women were killed in a shooting at a Lexington, Kentucky, church after a suspect, who had earlier shot and wounded a state trooper, fled to the church. The suspect was also killed by police. [12, 16]

articles.title: Small plane crashes at London Southend Airport, erupts in huge fireball; multiple flights cancelled
articles.description: A small aircraft crashed shortly after takeoff at London Southend Airport, resulting in a large fireball and the airport's closure with multiple flight cancellations. [4, 8, 14]

articles.title: Wildfire destroys a historic Grand Canyon lodge and other structures
articles.description: A fast-moving wildfire, identified as the Dragon Bravo Fire, has destroyed the historic Grand Canyon Lodge and dozens of other structures on the North Rim, leading to the closure of the area for the season. [3, 5, 9, 11]

articles.title: LIVE: Israel kills dozens as it bombards Gaza, Lebanon and Syria
articles.description: Israel has launched air attacks on Bekaa Valley in eastern Lebanon, killing at least 12 people, as well as in Syria's Suwayda. Meanwhile in Gaza, Israeli forces have killed at least 30 people, a day after killing at least 78 Palestinians across Gaza. Settlers in the occupied West Bank have set fire to Palestinian land and vehicles. [7, 10]

articles.title: Trump threatens Russia with tariffs and boosts US weapons for Ukraine
articles.description: President Donald Trump has announced new measures targeting Russia over its ongoing war in Ukraine, threatening steep tariffs if a peace deal isn't reached within 50 days. He also confirmed that the U.S. is sending Ukraine more Patriot air defense missiles, with European allies expected to finance these purchases. [11, 13, 17]

articles.title: DGCA orders airlines to inspect fuel switches on Boeing aircraft; Etihad cautions pilots
articles.description: India's aviation regulator, DGCA, has ordered airlines to inspect the lock on the fuel control switches on Boeing 787 and 737 planes by July 21. This directive follows a preliminary probe report into the Air India's Boeing 787 crash, which found that the fuel switches were cut off before the accident. [9, 12, 14]

articles.title: Trump Says US Attorney General Should Release Any 'Credible' Information On Epstein
articles.description: US President Donald Trump has stated that Attorney General Pam Bondi should release "whatever she thinks is credible" regarding late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, facing backlash from supporters after attempting to close the case. [4]

articles.title: 'American Idol' Music Supervisor And Husband Found Shot Dead In Los Angeles Home, Suspect Arrested
articles.description: A suspect has been arrested in connection with the murder of "American Idol" music supervisor Robin Kaye and her songwriter husband, Thomas Deluca, who were discovered shot to death in their Los Angeles home. [4]

articles.title: Severe summer storms head to the South and Midwest, millions under extreme weather alerts
articles.description: Dangerous weather conditions are persisting across the country, with the threat of severe summer storms moving towards the South and Midwest, placing millions of people under extreme weather alerts due to potential high winds and hail. [1]

articles.title: Israel bombs Syria Army headquarters after warning Damascus to leave Druze alone
articles.description: Israel bombed Syrian Army headquarters in Damascus on Wednesday (July 16, 2025) after warning the Islamist-led government to leave the Druze minority alone in its Sweida heartland where sectarian clashes have killed nearly 250 people. [2]

articles.title: Senate Passes $9 Billion in Cuts to Global Aid and Public Broadcasting
articles.description: The U.S. Senate voted to claw back $9 billion in federal funding for global aid programs and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, sending the package requested by President Trump to the House for a final vote. [4, 14]

articles.title: Trump Lashes Out at Supporters Demanding Release of Epstein Files
articles.description: President Trump has criticized some of his own supporters for demanding the release of Justice Department files related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, calling the conspiracy theory a "hoax" and those who believe it "stupid people." This comes as a prosecutor who worked on the Epstein case was reportedly fired by the US Justice Department. [4, 8, 12]

articles.title: At least 73 people killed waiting for humanitarian aid across Gaza, says Palestinian Health Ministry.
articles.description: At least 73 people were killed while attempting to access aid at locations across Gaza on Sunday (July 20, 2025), with the largest toll in northern Gaza where 67 Palestinians died trying to reach aid entering through the Zikim crossing with Israel. [3] Other reports indicate over 100 Palestinians were killed by Israeli troops, with 37 seeking food from aid centers. [6]

articles.title: Gaza: UN staff now fainting from hunger, exhaustion; WHO worker detained
articles.description: United Nations staff in Gaza are reportedly fainting from hunger and exhaustion, increasing fears for people's survival in the devastated enclave. The UN World Food Programme (WFP) also warned that Gaza's hunger crisis has reached new levels of desperation, with a third of the population not eating for multiple days in a row. [18]

articles.title: CNN halts show for 'breaking news' as poll delivers harsh blow to Donald Trump
articles.description: A new CNN poll reveals that 55% of Americans believe President Donald Trump has gone 'too far' with his latest immigration plans, a significant increase of 10 points since February. The poll also shows only 42% approval for his handling of immigration and 40% for his deportation policies. [19]

articles.title: Trump administration releases FBI records on MLK Jr. despite his family's opposition
articles.description: The federal government released thousands of records related to the 1968 assassination of Martin Luther King Jr., a move ordered by President Trump earlier this year. The Office of the Director of National Intelligence stated that over 230,000 pages of documents, previously undigitized, were released. [4, 13]

articles.title: PM Modi, Maldives President Muizzu hold talks to boost ties
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu held wide-ranging talks to consolidate cooperation in areas of trade, defense, and infrastructure, marking a significant improvement in their relationship.

articles.title: Thailand warns of war with Cambodia as 138,000 flee fighting
articles.description: Thailand's acting Prime Minister Phumtham Wechayachai warned that cross-border clashes with Cambodia, which have displaced over 130,000 people, could escalate into war. The UN Security Council is set to hold an emergency meeting on the crisis.

articles.title: The Epstein Files / Ghislaine Maxwell meets with Justice Department official for second day
articles.description: Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanch is meeting with convicted Epstein accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell for a second day amid public pressure for the Trump administration to release more information about Jeffrey Epstein.

articles.title: Southwest Plane Forced to Make Sudden Maneuver to Avoid Collision Midair
articles.description: A Southwest Airlines plane taking off from Hollywood Burbank Airport experienced two traffic alerts, prompting pilots to take aggressive action to avoid a potential mid-air collision. Passengers reported being thrown from their seats, with some hitting the cabin ceiling, and two flight attendants were treated for injuries. [1]

articles.title: Trump Doesn't Rule Out Pardoning Ghislaine Maxwell Amid DOJ Meetings
articles.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein's accomplice, underwent a second day of questioning by Justice Department officials. President Trump, when asked about a potential pardon, stated he hadn't considered it but affirmed he was 'allowed to do it,' drawing criticism from Democrats. [1, 4, 6]

articles.title: Thailand Warns of War with Cambodia as Border Clashes Escalate
articles.description: Intense cross-border clashes between Thailand and Cambodia have escalated, resulting in at least 20 deaths and displacing over 130,000 people. The fighting, which began in a disputed border area, marks the deadliest conflict between the two countries in over a decade, with Thailand's acting Prime Minister warning it 'could develop into war.' [1, 2, 4, 5]

articles.title: Ceasefire between Israel and Iran appears to hold as Trump vents frustration with both sides
articles.description: A fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel seemed to be holding, though President Trump expressed frustration with both nations for their prolonged conflict. Early US intelligence suggests that US strikes may have only set back Iran's nuclear program by months.

articles.title: Zohran Mamdani declares victory in NYC's Democratic mayoral primary as Cuomo concedes
articles.description: Zohran Mamdani has declared victory in New York City's Democratic mayoral primary, with Andrew Cuomo conceding the race. This development comes as the city experiences extreme heat, with temperatures reaching 100 degrees.

articles.title: Israeli army says seven soldiers killed in Gaza
articles.description: The Israeli army reported that seven soldiers were killed in Gaza. Meanwhile, Vietnam is set to remove the death penalty for embezzlement, potentially sparing a tycoon's life. In other news, the UK plans to purchase weapon-capable aircraft under NATO.

articles.title: Trump Rejects Pentagon Assessment That U.S. Strikes Failed to âObliterateâ Iran's Nuclear Program
articles.description: A classified report by the Defense Intelligence Agency suggests U.S. air strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities were less effective than claimed by the White House, setting the program back only months. President Trump and Secretary of State Marco Rubio have rejected these findings, leading to canceled Congressional briefings on the matter.

articles.title: Zohran Mamdani Beats Cuomo in NYC Mayoral Primary
articles.description: In a significant political upset, Zohran Mamdani, a 33-year-old Democratic socialist, has declared victory in the New York City mayoral primary, defeating former Governor Andrew Cuomo. This outcome is seen as a major win for the progressive movement in the city.

articles.title: Israeli Attacks on Gaza Kill Dozens, Including Palestinians Seeking Humanitarian Aid
articles.description: Reports from Gaza indicate that at least 41 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli attacks since midnight, with many targeted while seeking food and humanitarian aid. Israel has also issued new displacement orders for northern Gaza, leaving residents with no safe place to go.

articles.title: Israel Kills 72 Palestinians in Gaza; Ministry Reports 549 Aid Seekers Killed in a Month
articles.description: The Gaza Health Ministry reported that 72 Palestinians were killed in the past 24 hours due to Israeli strikes. Over the past month, 549 individuals seeking aid have lost their lives.

articles.title: Supreme Court Curbs Injunctions Blocking Trump's Birthright Citizenship Plan
articles.description: The Supreme Court has placed restrictions on injunctions that had previously halted President Trump's executive order concerning birthright citizenship.

articles.title: Japan Executes 'Twitter Killer' Convicted of Murdering Nine People
articles.description: Japan has executed a man who was convicted of murdering and dismembering nine people, a crime that gained notoriety due to his online activities.

articles.title: Israeli attacks on Gaza kill 81 Palestinians in 24 hours; Trump halts US-Canada trade talks
articles.description: Israeli attacks in Gaza have resulted in the deaths of 81 Palestinians in the past 24 hours, with six killed near an aid distribution point in Rafah. Meanwhile, President Trump has abruptly ended trade talks with Canada due to a new tax on American tech companies, calling it a "direct and blatant attack on our country." The U.S. Supreme Court also delivered a significant win to the Trump administration by limiting the power of federal judges to issue nationwide injunctions.
articles.source: Al Jazeera, NBC News, The Indian Express

articles.title: Supreme Court limits federal judges' power, Trump claims victory in Iran nuclear site claims
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has significantly limited the power of individual federal judges to issue nationwide injunctions, a decision seen as a major victory for President Trump. In parallel, Trump continues to assert that U.S. airstrikes "obliterated" Iran's nuclear sites, despite some intelligence officials' assessments to the contrary. Iran's foreign minister has acknowledged that the strikes inflicted "significant and serious damage" to its nuclear facilities.
articles.source: The Hindu, PBS News Hour, Newsweek

articles.title: India's economic and diplomatic activities, plus sports news
articles.description: India is exporting advanced diesel locomotives to Mozambique and has seen an 11% rise in office space demand in Q2 2025. The nation also called for a resolution to border demarcation with China and held talks with Russia on defense procurement. In sports, India dominated the 2nd Asian Squash Doubles Championships, winning all three titles, and Neeraj Chopra secured a victory at the Ostrava Golden Spike 2025.

articles.title: Smriti Mandhana's Century Leads India to Dominant Win Over England in Women's T20Is
articles.description: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana scored a century, and debutant Shree Charani took four wickets, as India secured a significant victory against England in a women's T20 international match. This marks England's worst-ever loss in this format.

articles.title: US Supreme Court Curbs Power of Individual Judges to Block Executive Actions
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court, in a 6-3 ruling, has limited the authority of single federal judges to issue nationwide injunctions against executive actions. This decision stems from a case involving President Trump's attempt to end birthright citizenship.

articles.title: Iran Holds State Funeral for Commanders and Scientists Killed in Conflict with Israel
articles.description: Iran held a state funeral for prominent figures, including top military commanders and nuclear scientists, who were killed during a recent 12-day conflict with Israel. Thousands attended the ceremony in Tehran.

articles.title: Agra airport receives threat mail; security tightened
articles.description: Security at Agra airport has been beefed up after it received a threat mail, police said on Monday. The airport security filed a complaint regarding the threatening email on Sunday, following which a case was registered. The FIR has been registered under BNS Section 351(4) (criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication) and Section 66F of the IT Act. Similar emails have been received at other locations as well, and a thorough investigation is underway.

articles.title: Two Idaho firefighters killed in ambush attack; suspected gunman dead
articles.description: Two firefighters were killed and a third wounded in an ambush by a man who set a fire to lure them to the area in Idaho. The suspected gunman was found dead. The incident occurred outside Coeur d'Alene.

articles.title: Canada rescinds digital services tax after Trump suspends trade talks
articles.description: Canada has rescinded its plan to tax U.S. technology firms, a move that led President Trump to suspend trade talks. Canadian Prime Minister Carney announced that U.S.-Canada trade talks are resuming.

articles.title: Six workers killed, five injured in explosion at firecracker unit near Sivakasi
articles.description: Six workers have been killed in a fire accident at Gokhales Fireworks unit at Chinnakamanpatti village near Sivakasi in Virudhunagar district on Tuesday (July 1, 2025). Five other workers were injured, of whom the condition of three is said to be critical. All the injured have been admitted to the Government Hospital in Sivakasi.

articles.title: Death toll in Telangana pharma factory blast rises to 36; Kolkata law college expels 3 accused in gang rape case, and more
articles.description: The death toll in the Telangana pharma factory blast has risen to 36, and a Kolkata law college has expelled three accused in a gang rape case. These are among the top news stories of the day on July 1, 2025.

articles.title: Bryan Kohberger to plead guilty to murder in Idaho student stabbings to avoid death penalty
articles.description: Bryan Kohberger is expected to plead guilty to all counts in the Idaho college killings case to avoid the death penalty. This is one of the top news stories being reported on July 1, 2025.

articles.title: Israeli attacks on Gaza killed nearly 100 Palestinians on Monday
articles.description: Israeli warplanes bombed a seaside cafe in northern Gaza City, killing at least 39 people, including children. Photojournalist Ismail Abu Hatab was among the dead. Separately, Israel attacked tents housing displaced people at Al-Aqsa Hospital. Gaza's hunger crisis deepens, with the UN warning of a complete lack of infant formula and at least 66 children already dead from malnutrition.

articles.title: Trump to Attend Opening of "Alligator Alcatraz" ICE Jail in Florida
articles.description: President Trump is set to attend the opening of a new immigration detention facility in the Florida Everglades, dubbed "Alligator Alcatraz." The facility, a mass detention tent camp, is expected to hold up to 5,000 people awaiting deportation and will cost an estimated $450 million annually to operate.

articles.title: Six workers killed in fire accident at fireworks unit near Sivakasi
articles.description: A fire at the Gokhales Fireworks unit in Chinnakamanpatti village, near Sivakasi, has resulted in the deaths of six workers and injured five others, with three in critical condition. The injured have been admitted to the Government Hospital in Sivakasi.

articles.title: Senate Narrowly Approves Massive Bill to Gut Social Programs and Cut Taxes on the Rich
articles.description: The U.S. Senate passed a sweeping bill that includes tax breaks for the wealthy and significant cuts to social programs like Medicaid and food assistance. Vice President JD Vance cast the tie-breaking vote. The legislation also increases funding for deportation efforts, deregulates AI and cryptocurrency, and ends subsidies for renewable energy.

articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs Acquitted on Most Serious Charges, Denied Bail
articles.description: Hip-hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs was acquitted of sex trafficking and racketeering charges but convicted on two lesser counts related to prostitution. Despite the mixed verdict, which some view as a legal victory, the judge denied him bail, meaning he will remain in custody.

articles.title: Seven Missing After Fireworks Warehouse Explosion in California
articles.description: Seven people are missing following a massive explosion and fire that destroyed a commercial fireworks facility in rural Northern California. The incident occurred on Tuesday evening, with aerial footage showing the building completely leveled.

articles.title: Russia hammers Kyiv in largest missile and drone barrage since war in Ukraine began
articles.description: Russia launched 550 drones and missiles across Ukraine overnight in the largest aerial assault since the war began, with the capital Kyiv being the primary target. The attack injured 23 people and caused widespread damage.

articles.title: 'One Big Beautiful Bill': Trump secures major victory as flagship bill passes Congress
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump secured a major political victory as Congress narrowly passed his flagship tax and spending bill. The bill, which cements his second-term agenda, boosts funds for his anti-immigration drive and has been described as 'One Big Beautiful Bill'. Critics, however, point to potential cuts in healthcare and food assistance programs.

articles.title: Dozens of Palestinians killed by airstrikes or shootings while waiting for aid
articles.description: Reports indicate that dozens of Palestinians have been killed by Israeli airstrikes or shootings while waiting for aid in Gaza. The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF), an American- and Israeli-backed group, is facing scrutiny over its operations, with accusations that its contractors fired live ammunition at civilians seeking aid.

articles.title: Texas flash floods kill at least 24 people, 23 girl campers missing
articles.description: Central Texas is experiencing a catastrophic flood emergency, with at least 24 people confirmed dead and over 20 children missing from a summer camp after a sudden surge along the Guadalupe River. Helicopters are conducting rescue operations as water levels rose rapidly, sweeping away cars and homes.

articles.title: Russia launches largest missile and drone barrage on Kyiv since war in Ukraine began
articles.description: Russia unleashed an aerial assault of drones and missiles on Ukraine, marking the largest attack of the war. Kyiv was the primary target, with over 550 drones and missiles injuring dozens and causing destruction.

articles.title: Trump signs 'big, beautiful bill' on U.S. Independence Day
articles.description: President Donald Trump signed a sweeping package of tax breaks and spending cuts into law on July 4, 2025, calling it his 'One Big Beautiful Bill Act.' The legislation, which passed with near-unanimous Republican support, is expected to have a significant impact on the economy.

articles.title: Texas floods leave at least 51 dead, 27 girls missing as rescuers search devastated landscape
articles.description: Rescuers are searching for survivors, including 27 girls, after historic flash floods in central Texas killed at least 43 people, including 15 children. Several more people died in nearby counties.

articles.title: Elon Musk launches the America Party as feud with Trump escalates
articles.description: Elon Musk has announced the formation of a new political party, the America Party, in opposition to President Donald Trump's tax bill, which Musk argues will bankrupt the country. Musk, who previously supported Trump, criticized the bill for increasing the deficit and vowed to challenge lawmakers who supported it.

articles.title: Trump signs 'big, beautiful' bill on U.S. Independence Day
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump signed his package of tax breaks and spending cuts into law Friday, July 4, 2025, after securing almost unanimous Republican support. The bill includes permanent tax cuts, increased defense spending, and reforms in healthcare and immigration, though critics warn it could add $3.4 trillion to the national debt.

articles.title: Death toll from Texas floods reaches 78; Trump plans visit
articles.description: The death toll from catastrophic floods in Texas reached at least 78 on Sunday, including 28 children, as the search for girls missing from a summer camp continued and fears of more flooding prompted evacuations of volunteer responders. Larry Leitha, sheriff of Kerr County in Texas Hill Country, said 68 people had died in flooding in his county, the epicenter of the flooding, among them 28 children. Texas Governor Greg Abbott, speaking at a press conference on Sunday afternoon, said another 10 had died elsewhere in Texas and confirmed 41 were missing.

articles.title: At Least 81 Dead And Dozens Missing In Texas Floods As More Rain Looms
articles.description: At least 81 people have been confirmed dead and another 41 are missing following flash floods in central Texas on Friday. Most of the fatalities were in Kerr County, where a riverside Christian girls' camp was deluged, claiming the lives of a number of children and leaving others missing. Other areas to record deaths include Travis County, Burnet County, Williamson County, Kendall County and Tom Green County.

articles.title: Texas flooding: What happened, what went wrong and what's the death toll?
articles.description: The death toll from catastrophic floods in Texas has climbed to at least 82. That number includes 28 children who were at a summer camp when the deluge hit. 10 girls and a camp counselor are still unaccounted for. Overall, at least 41 remain missing. The flooding occurred after the nearby Guadalupe River broke its banks after torrential rains Friday during the US Independence Day holiday. Authorities are warning of more heavy rainfall in the coming days.

articles.title: Texas Floods Kill at Least 82 People, with Dozens Still Missing and More Rains Forecast
articles.description: Search and rescue missions are continuing in central Texas, where the death toll from catastrophic flooding has reached 82 people, with dozens still missing. In the most devastated area, Kerr County, at least 40 adults and 28 children died in the flooding. Among those still missing are at least 10 girls from Camp Mystic, an all-girls summer camp on the banks of the Guadalupe River, which officials say swelled and rose some 26 feet in under an hour Friday amid torrential downpours.

articles.title: Search continues after deadly Texas flooding
articles.description: Recovery teams in Texas are still searching for survivors following last week's historic flash floods. Officials now confirm more than 100 people have died, including nearly 30 from an all-girls sleepaway camp in Kerr County. Ten children and one counselor from Camp Mystic remain missing. Hundreds of rescue workers and volunteers are still combing through debris.

articles.title: Top Story with Tom Llamas - July 7 | NBC News NOW
articles.description: The death toll from the Texas flooding has surpassed 100, raising questions and calls for accountability; President Trump extends the tariff deadline; and a man is killed after exchanging fire with an agent at a Texas border facility.

articles.title: Death Toll from Texas Floods Tops 100 as Hope Fades for Missing Victims
articles.description: The death toll from catastrophic July 4 floods in Texas has reached 104, with 27 victims from a summer camp. Ten children and one counselor remain missing. Officials admit flood warning sirens were not placed along the Guadalupe River years ago due to cost.

articles.title: Netanyahu and Trump Promote Plan to Expel Palestinians from Gaza
articles.description: President Donald Trump hosted Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House, where they discussed a plan to expel thousands of Palestinians from Gaza. Netanyahu presented Trump with a letter nominating him for a Nobel Peace Prize and stated they are working to find countries willing to receive Palestinians.

articles.title: Trump Sending More Weapons to Ukraine Because He's âNot Happy with Putinâ
articles.description: President Trump announced the U.S. will send more weapons to Ukraine, stating he is "not happy with President Putin at all." This marks a shift after a recent halt in shipments, attributed to concerns over Pentagon stockpiles.

articles.title: Two pilots killed after IAF Jaguar fighter jet crashes near Churu in Rajasthan
articles.description: Two pilots of the Indian Air Force (IAF) were killed on Wednesday morning in a crash of a Jaguar trainer aircraft near Churu in Rajasthan. The IAF stated that a court of inquiry has been constituted to ascertain the cause of the accident.

articles.title: At least 10 killed as bridge collapses in Vadodara
articles.description: At least ten people were killed after a portion of the Gambhira Bridge near Mujpur in Padra taluka of Gujarat's Vadodara district collapsed. Five to six vehicles plunged into the Mahisagar River after a slab of the bridge collapsed.

articles.title: Russia Launches Massive Aerial Attack on Western Ukraine as Trump Blasts Putin
articles.description: Ukraine's Air Force reported that Russia launched its largest aerial attack since the 2022 invasion, firing 741 drones and missiles, primarily targeting Lutsk in western Ukraine. Poland activated its air defenses and scrambled fighter jets in response.

articles.title: Magnitude 4.4 earthquake jolts Haryana; tremors felt across Delhi-NCR
articles.description: A powerful earthquake struck near Jhajjar in Haryana at 9:04 am on Thursday, causing strong tremors to be felt across the Delhi-NCR region. Residents in Delhi, Noida, and Gurgaon were seen rushing out of buildings and homes in panic. However, there have been no immediate reports of casualties or property damage. The earthquake was recorded at a magnitude of 4.4.

articles.title: Gujarat bridge collapse: Death toll rises to 18; 2 still missing
articles.description: Death toll in the collapse of a bridge over the Mahisagar river in Gujarat's Vadodara district rose to 18 on Thursday. The search operation for the missing persons will resume on Friday as two persons are still missing. Authorities said while NDRF and SDRF teams are conducting searches in the river, thick layer of mud and rain is making the process difficult. A few vehicles are still submerged in the river.

articles.title: Four Dead, 11 Missing in Wake of Houthi Attack on Red Sea Vessel
articles.description: A Houthi strike on a Red Sea commercial vessel Tuesday is now believed to have killed four people, with 11 people missing, six of whom are believed to be in Houthi hands. Israel says it intercepted a missile strike by Yemen's Houthi group targeting Ben Gurion Airport earlier today. This comes as Houthi fighters escalate their attacks on Israel over its war on Gaza.

articles.title: Texas Flood Death Toll Reaches 121; 160 People Still Missing
articles.description: The death toll in Texas has risen to at least 121, one week after the historic flash floods devastated the state. Over 160 people remain unaccounted for. Rescue efforts include volunteer teams from Mexico, such as the Topos Azteca firefighters.

articles.title: India hit nine terrorist bases of Pakistan in Operation Sindoor: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval
articles.description: National Security Advisor Ajit Doval stated that India successfully targeted nine terrorist bases in Pakistan during 'Operation Sindoor,' emphasizing the precision and swiftness of the operation.

articles.title: Judge Blocks Trump's Birthright Ban, Allows Class-Action Lawsuit to Proceed
articles.description: A U.S. judge has blocked President Trump's executive order to terminate birthright citizenship, allowing a class-action lawsuit to challenge the order. This ruling permits plaintiffs to contest the order after the Supreme Court's recent move to restrict nationwide injunctions.

articles.title: Building Collapse in Delhi Kills Six, Rescue Operations Underway
articles.description: A four-storey building collapsed in the Welcome area of northeast Delhi, resulting in at least six deaths and eight injuries. Rescue operations are ongoing as authorities fear more people may be trapped.

articles.title: Trump Threatens 30% Tariffs on EU and Mexico, Sparks Global Reaction
articles.description: US President Donald Trump has announced a 30% import tax on all goods from the EU and Mexico, effective August 1st. This move has drawn criticism from European allies and is expected to impact global trade.

articles.title: Air India Crash Investigation: Fuel Cut Off Moments Before Impact
articles.description: An investigation into the Air India crash has revealed that the plane's engines were shut down shortly after takeoff, with fuel being cut off moments before the crash. The preliminary report suggests the conversation between pilots was brief.

articles.title: Monsoon havoc in Himachal: 92 dead, 250 roads closed, Mandi severely affected
articles.description: Relentless rainfall continues to lash Himachal Pradesh, causing landslides, flash floods, and widespread disruption. At least 92 people have lost their lives, and 249 roads remain closed across the state.

articles.title: Pilots' union disputes Air India crash report, alleges investigation bias
articles.description: Following the release of the preliminary findings on the Air India 171 crash, the Pilots' Association of India voiced serious concerns, claiming the investigation seems to assume pilot fault from the outset.

articles.title: Jannik Sinner claims first Wimbledon Title with dominant win over Amanda Anisimova
articles.description: Jannik Sinner's emotionally restrained, methodical and precise tennis earned its greatest gift yet as he dethroned two-time defending champion Carlos Alcaraz 4-6, 6-4, 6-4, 6-4 to win his first Wimbledon and fourth Major title.

articles.title: Astronauts from India, Poland and Hungary head back to Earth after private space station mission
articles.description: The Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4) crew, including Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, returned to Earth after an 18-day stay at the International Space Station. The mission concluded with a splashdown off the California coast.

articles.title: Nine Killed And Dozens Hurt In Fire At Massachusetts Assisted-Living Home
articles.description: A fire swept through an assisted living facility in Fall River, Massachusetts, resulting in the deaths of at least nine people. Dozens of residents and five firefighters were hospitalized.

articles.title: Grand Canyon Lodge Destroyed by Wildfire
articles.description: A wildfire has destroyed the historic Grand Canyon Lodge on the North Rim of the Grand Canyon, closing an access point for visitors. Park officials confirmed the lodge, administrative buildings, and visitor facilities were consumed by flames.

articles.title: Millions Face Flood Threats After Deadly East Coast Storms; Trump Calls for Epstein Files Release
articles.description: Millions of Americans are under flood watches following severe storms that caused fatalities along the East Coast. Meanwhile, House Speaker Mike Johnson is calling for the release of the Epstein files, and President Trump has commented on the situation.

articles.title: Trump Threatens Tariffs on Russia, Urges Ukraine Not to Target Moscow
articles.description: President Trump has threatened significant tariffs on countries trading with Russia if President Putin does not agree to a peace deal within 50 days. He also reportedly encouraged Ukraine to strike deeper into Russian territory, including Moscow.

articles.title: Severe Storms Cause Fatalities, Flooding Across Northeast; Trump Administration Actions Under Scrutiny
articles.description: Deadly storms have led to widespread flooding across the Northeast, with two people killed in New Jersey. The Trump administration's policies on immigration and its handling of the Epstein files are also facing scrutiny.

articles.title: Syria says pulling troops from Druze heartland after U.S. request
articles.description: Syria announced that its army had begun to withdraw from violence-hit Sweida on Wednesday (July 16, 2025), following a wave of Israeli strikes on the capital and a U.S. call for government forces to leave the majority-Druze southern city. Israel's military says it's bombed the Syrian army headquarters in Damascus, with Syrian media reporting two civilians were injured in the attack. This comes as fighting resumed between Syrian government forces and Druze armed groups after a ceasefire agreement collapsed. Delegates from 30 countries gathered in Bogotaa, Colombia, for an emergency conference on the situation in Gaza, led by South Africa and Colombia.

articles.title: Maurene Comey, prosecutor in 'Diddy,' Epstein, Maxwell cases, daughter of ex FBI head, fired from DOJ
articles.description: Maurene Comey, who was involved in prosecuting cases involving Sean "Diddy" Combs and Jeffrey Epstein, and is the daughter of former FBI director James Comey, has been fired from the Department of Justice. This action comes as President Trump has been lashing out at Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and has asked GOP lawmakers if he should be fired. Additionally, the Senate passed President Trump's request to rescind funding, including cuts to foreign aid and public broadcasting.

articles.title: 7.3 magnitude earthquake prompts tsunami advisory in southern Alaska
articles.description: A 7.3 magnitude earthquake off the coast of Alaska has triggered a tsunami warning, with families advised to move to higher ground. Separately, a passenger jet departing from Los Angeles experienced engine fire, forcing an emergency landing. Authorities are also investigating an incident involving a suspect in the cockpit of another plane, leading to the deployment of F-15s. In political news, President Trump has criticized some of his supporters, calling them "stupid people," amid ongoing questions in the Jeffrey Epstein case. An "American Idol" producer and her husband were found shot to death, and a suspect is in custody.
articles.source: ABC World News Tonight with David Muir

articles.title: Trump diagnosed with 'chronic venous insufficiency' after swelling: White House
articles.description: President Trump has been diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency after experiencing swelling in his legs. The White House physician released a letter stating the president remains in excellent health.

articles.title: Trump orders release of grand jury testimony in Epstein case in wake of Wall Street Journal report
articles.description: President Trump has ordered the release of grand jury testimony related to Jeffrey Epstein, following a Wall Street Journal report about a 2003 letter. The White House is attempting to move past the controversy surrounding the Epstein files.

articles.title: 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert' Is Being Canceled by CBS
articles.description: CBS has announced that 'The Late Show with Stephen Colbert' will end in May 2026. The decision marks the end of the franchise, which has been a staple of late-night television.

articles.title: Trump sues Murdoch, WSJ over Epstein report
articles.description: President Trump announced that he is suing the publisher and owner of the Wall Street Journal, media tycoon Rupert Murdoch, and others in a $10 billion libel lawsuit. This comes less than 24 hours after the Journal published a report claiming Mr. Trump wrote Jeffrey Epstein a "bawdy" birthday note in 2003. [15]

articles.title: 3 sheriff's deputies killed in explosion at Los Angeles training facility
articles.description: Three sheriff's deputies were killed in an explosion at a sheriff's training facility in Los Angeles. [4] The explosion occurred at a training center, killing three deputies. [2]

articles.title: Ten Americans freed in prisoner swap between U.S., El Salvador, Venezuela
articles.description: Ten Americans are en route to the U.S. after a prisoner swap involving the U.S., El Salvador and Venezuela, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Friday. [15] Ten Americans were freed in a prisoner swap in El Salvador. [2]

articles.title: 73 Palestinians killed waiting for humanitarian aid across Gaza, health ministry says
articles.description: At least 73 people were killed while attempting to access aid at locations across Gaza on Sunday, July 20, 2025, the Health Ministry in the Palestinian territory said. The largest toll was in northern Gaza, where at least 67 Palestinians were killed while trying to reach aid entering northern Gaza through the Zikim crossing with Israel, according to the ministry and local hospitals.

articles.title: Trump suing the Wall Street Journal denying reporting he sent a birthday note to Jeffrey Epstein
articles.description: President Trump is suing the Wall Street Journal, denying reporting that he sent a birthday note to Jeffrey Epstein. The paper's response overnight indicates the Justice Department has officially asked the court to unseal grand jury transcripts in the Epstein case. The article also mentions a prisoner swap where Venezuela freed 10 Americans in exchange for 250 Venezuelans deported by the US to a prison in El Salvador.

articles.title: Top news of the day: PM Modi to visit the U.K. and Maldives between July 23-26; Government ready to discuss all issues raised by Opposition at all-party meeting, and more
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will visit the United Kingdom and the Maldives from July 23 to July 26. The government is ready to discuss all issues raised by the Opposition at an all-party meeting. The article also mentions that the 15-year-old girl set on fire by miscreants in Odisha has been airlifted to AIIMS Delhi for advanced treatment.

articles.title: Top news of the day | July 20, 2025
articles.description: The government is ready to discuss all issues raised by the Opposition in Parliament. Meanwhile, at least 73 people were killed waiting for humanitarian aid in Gaza. Tsunami threat over after powerful quakes strike off Russia's coast. A case is registered against NCP (SP) MLA Rohit Pawar for shouting at police. A 15-year-old girl set on fire in Odisha was airlifted to AIIMS Delhi.

articles.title: Top news of the day on July 21, 2025
articles.description: Former Kerala CM V.S. Achuthanandan passes away at 101. Parliament Monsoon Session witnesses disruptions over Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. A parliamentary panel retains provisions allowing tax officials to access social media and private emails. The Bombay High Court acquits all 12 accused in the 7/11 Mumbai train blasts case. Opposition MPs submit notice in Rajya Sabha for removal of Justice Varma.

articles.title: PBS News Weekend full episode - July 20, 2025
articles.description: Israel's military issues new evacuation orders for central Gaza as more than 80 Palestinians are killed trying to get food aid. Thousands of lead pipes are removed from Flint, Michigan. Malaysia stops accepting plastic waste from the U.S. The rise of mental health misinformation on social media is also discussed.

articles.title: Israeli Tanks & Snipers Kill 79 Palestinians at Aid Site in Northern Gaza
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 115 Palestinians on Sunday, including 92 people who died while seeking aid. In the deadliest incident, Israeli troops massacred at least 79 people at the Zikim crossing in northern Gaza, where Palestinians gathered to wait for aid trucks. The UN agency stated that the crowd came under fire from Israeli tanks, snipers, and other gunfire as the convoy approached. Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza City reported being overwhelmed with victims shot by Israel.

articles.title: Bangladesh Air Force training aircraft crashes into school in Dhaka, killing 16
articles.description: A Bangladesh Air Force training aircraft crashed into a school building in Dhaka, resulting in 16 fatalities, predominantly children, and injuring dozens. The incident occurred in the Uttara area of Dhaka, impacting the Milestone School and College campus.

articles.title: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigns citing medical issues
articles.description: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post on July 21, 2025, citing medical reasons. The Union Home Ministry issued a gazette notification of his resignation on July 22, 2025, less than 24 hours after he submitted it. Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged the resignation on social media, wishing him good health.

articles.title: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath frontman and heavy metal legend, dies at 76
articles.description: Ozzy Osbourne, the iconic frontman of Black Sabbath and a pioneering figure in heavy metal music, has passed away at the age of 76. His family confirmed his death, remembering him as a beloved figure who battled various health challenges throughout his life.

articles.title: Trump accuses Obama of treason in escalating attacks over 2016 Russia probe
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has accused former President Barack Obama of "treason," alleging without evidence that Obama led an effort to falsely link Trump to Russia and undermine his 2016 presidential campaign. Obama's office called the accusations "outrageous."

articles.title: DOJ seeks interview with Epstein's convicted associate Ghislane Maxwell
articles.description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) has announced its intention to seek an interview with Ghislane Maxwell, the convicted associate of Jeffrey Epstein. Maxwell is currently serving a 20-year prison sentence.

articles.title: Trump Announces Trade Deal with Japan, Imposing 15% Tariff
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with Japan, including a 15% tariff on goods imported from the nation. He stated the deal would create hundreds of thousands of jobs and maintain a strong relationship between the U.S. and Japan. [1, 2, 3, 6]

articles.title: Humanitarian Organizations Demand End to Gaza Siege Amidst Spreading Starvation
articles.description: Over 100 humanitarian organizations are calling for an end to Israel's siege of Gaza, warning of widespread starvation. They report increasing illnesses, empty markets, and people collapsing from hunger and dehydration, with the Palestinian Ministry of Health stating at least 111 starvation-related deaths. [2, 3, 14]

articles.title: Bryan Kohberger Sentenced to Life in Prison for University of Idaho Murders
articles.description: Bryan Kohberger has been sentenced to life in prison without parole for the murders of four University of Idaho students. Victims' families delivered emotional statements in court before his sentencing. [7, 9, 15]

articles.title: Wrestling legend Hulk Hogan dies at 71
articles.description: The iconic professional wrestler Hulk Hogan has passed away at the age of 71. His death was reported to be due to cardiac arrest, and an investigation is underway. Hogan was a major figure in the world of professional wrestling, known for his larger-than-life persona and catchphrases.

articles.title: France to recognize Palestine as a state, says Macron
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron announced that France will recognize Palestine as a state, amidst growing international concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. This decision comes as reports indicate widespread starvation among the population in Gaza.

articles.title: US cuts short Gaza ceasefire talks, blames Hamas
articles.description: The United States has ended ceasefire talks in Qatar, stating that Hamas's latest response indicates a lack of willingness to reach a truce. This comes as reports highlight a severe humanitarian crisis in Gaza, with children reportedly starving to death.

articles.title: Top Story with Tom Llamas - July 25 | NBC News NOW
articles.description: A Southwest plane in California descended minutes into the flight to avoid a collision, a manhunt is underway after a deadly shooting at the University of New Mexico, and millions of Americans are facing severe weather from coast to coast. President Trump also commented on pardoning Ghislaine Maxwell and the ongoing situation in Gaza.

articles.title: Top news of the day: PM Modi, Maldives President Muizzu hold talks to boost ties; Cambodia backs ceasefire proposal to resolve conflict with Thailand, and more
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held talks with Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu to strengthen cooperation in trade, defense, and infrastructure. Meanwhile, Thailand warned of potential war with Cambodia following deadly border clashes that have displaced over 130,000 people.

articles.title: Catch Me Up: Daily news roundup for July 25, 2025
articles.description: This daily news roundup covers top stories from the Bay Area, including San Mateo County Sheriff Christina Corpus calling for open proceedings, healthcare worker strikes in San Francisco and the East Bay, and discussions on new funding for regional transit. It also highlights the plight of a historic lighthouse seeking funds for repairs.

articles.title: Six killed in Haridwar Mansa Devi temple stampede
articles.description: At least six people died and at least two dozen were injured in a stampede at Haridwar's Mansa Devi temple on Sunday, July 27, 2025. The stampede occurred after rumors of an electric shock to a devotee caused panic.

articles.title: Israel announces military pause in three Gaza areas to address surging hunger
articles.description: The Israeli military announced on Sunday, July 27, 2025, that it would pause fighting in three populated areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day and open secure routes for aid delivery to address a surge in hunger.

articles.title: Russia scales down celebrations honouring its navy as Ukraine launches more drone attacks
articles.description: Russia scaled down its Navy Day celebrations on Sunday, July 27, 2025, citing security concerns due to ongoing Ukrainian drone attacks. Parades in St. Petersburg, Kaliningrad, and Vladivostok were cancelled.

articles.title: Stranded F-35B Fighter Jet In Kerala To Get C-17 Globemaster Farewell
articles.description: Nineteen days after a British F-35B stealth fighter jet made an unscheduled landing at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, the state-of-the-art aircraft remains grounded.

articles.description: Over 25 crore workers from government sectors such as banking, postal services, mining, construction, and transport will go on a nationwide general strike, or Bharat Bandh, on Wednesday, July 9.

articles.description: A man was sucked into an aircraft engine on the taxiway at Milan Bergamo Airport in Italy on Tuesday morning.

articles.description: Tomy and Shiny, a Kerala-based couple, used to run 'A&A Chits and Finance', a chit fund institution offering high returns, ranging between 15 to 20 per cent on investments.

articles.description: A father heroically jumped off a Disney cruise ship to save his daughter who fell overboard from the fourth deck. The incident occurred as the ship was returning to Fort Lauderdale, Florida, after a four-day cruise through the Bahamas.

To avoid detection, he misused customers' KYC details like Aadhaar to open 21 accounts, implicating unwitting individuals.

articles.title: Cierra Ortega removed from Love Island USA after racist posts spark outrage: This is what she said
articles.description: Cierra Ortega was swiftly removed from Love Island USA Season 7 after racist social media posts resurfaced, including anti-Asian slurs used in 2015 and 2020. The backlash was immediate, with Ortega losing nearly 200,000 Instagram followers. Producers acted quickly, citing unacceptable language, leaving her partner Nic Vansteenberghe single and reigniting debates about contestant vetting.

articles.title: CIA radios and yak butter, and hours to spare: How a 23-year-old monk outwitted the Dragon empire
articles.description: In 1959, the 14th Dalai Lama, disguised as a soldier, slipped out of Lhasa under the nose of the Chinese army. An ominous invitation to watch a dance without guards pushed Tibetâs spiritual leader to flee across the Himalayas. Sheltered by India, he built a new Tibetan home in exile. This is the real story of that cold, desperate escape, Nehruâs gamble, and the defiance that still shapes Tibetâs struggle for identity and freedom.

articles.title: Tripura Teen Goes Missing In Delhi, Chief Minister Manik Saha Intervenes
articles.description: Sneha, a student of Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College, Delhi University, was last in contact with her family on July 7.

articles.description: Billionaire Elon Musk asked his former ally and US President, Donald Trump, to just release the case files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as promised.

articles.description: In Texas, at least 120 people have died from flash floods, with over 170 still missing. The search for victims continues along extensive riverbanks and debris. The floods forced families to make urgent escapes, and recovery efforts are hindered by heat and debris.

articles.title: Trump announces 30% tariffs against EU, Mexico to begin August 1
articles.description: President Donald Trump has announced 30% tariffs on imports from the European Union and Mexico, set to begin on August 1. This move is part of his broader strategy to address trade imbalances and revive the U.S. economy.

articles.title: Guatemalan villagers lynch 5 men accused of robbing homes after earthquakes
articles.description: In Guatemala, residents of Santa Maria de Jesus lynched five men accused of robbing homes damaged by recent earthquakes. The community, still lacking electricity and potable water, took matters into their own hands amid the crisis.

articles.description: A tourist boat capsized in Ha Long Bay, Vietnam, during a sudden thunderstorm, resulting in the deaths of at least 37 people. The boat was carrying 48 passengers and five crew members. Rescue teams have recovered 37 bodies and found 10 survivors, including a 14-year-old boy who was trapped in the overturned hull for four hours [4].

articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine with over 300 drones, killing 1 in Odesa
articles.description: Russia launched a massive drone attack on Ukraine, deploying over 300 drones and resulting in one fatality in Odesa [1, 5].

articles.title: Astronomer CEO resigns after Coldplay concert video
articles.description: The CEO of Astronomer has resigned following controversy over a video captured at a Coldplay concert [1, 2].

articles.title: After killing aid seekers, Israel attacks water desalination plant in Gaza
articles.description: Following the killing of aid seekers, Israel has reportedly attacked a water desalination plant in Gaza [1].

articles.title: Bangladesh air force plane crashes into college campus, killing at least 19
articles.description: A Bangladesh air force training jet crashed into a school in Dhaka, resulting in the deaths of at least 19 people [1, 4].

articles.title: Trump files libel lawsuit against Wall Street Journal and Rupert Murdoch
articles.description: Donald Trump has filed a libel lawsuit against the Wall Street Journal and Rupert Murdoch [3].

articles.title: Number of aid seekers killed by Israel in Gaza tops 1,000: UN
articles.description: According to the UN, Israeli forces have killed over 1,000 Palestinians trying to access food in Gaza since the US- and Israeli-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF) began operations at the end of May. The UN reports that 766 people were killed near GHF sites and 288 near UN and other humanitarian organizations' aid convoys [2].

articles.title: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, 'Cosby Show' actor, dies at 54 in Costa Rica drowning
articles.description: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, known for his role on 'The Cosby Show,' has reportedly died at the age of 54 in a drowning accident in Costa Rica [3].

articles.title: Trump administration releases FBI records on MLK Jr. despite his family's opposition
articles.description: The Trump administration has released FBI records concerning Martin Luther King Jr., despite opposition from his family [3, 4].

articles.title: More than 100 aid groups warn of starvation in Gaza as Israeli strikes kill 21 overnight
articles.description: More than 100 charity and human rights groups say that Israel's blockade and ongoing military offensive are pushing Palestinians in the Gaza Strip toward starvation [3, 4].

articles.title: Exhibit shines light on African American veterans
articles.description: At Dallas College's Cliff Gallery, "Honor Endures" showcases portraits by Keith Vinson and others that honor the lives, struggles, and strength of African American service members [2].

articles.title: Trump's treason claims against Obama and others prompt a rare response from the former president
articles.description: Donald Trump's claims of treason against Barack Obama and others have elicited a rare response from the former president [3, 4].

articles.title: Gaza logs 15 new deaths from hunger, taking toll since Israel's war to 101
articles.description: At least 15 Palestinians, including four children, have starved to death in a single day in the besieged Gaza Strip, bringing the total number of deaths from malnutrition since Israel's war began to 101. The UN describes the situation in Gaza as a âhorror show with a level of death and destruction without parallel in recent timesâ [3].

articles.title: Major media say Gaza staff face starvation as US envoy prepares to host ceasefire talks
articles.description: Four leading news organizations say their journalists in Gaza are facing the threat of starvation as the Israel-Hamas war grinds on [4].

articles.title: Trump's treason claims against Obama and others prompt a rare response from the former president
articles.description: Former President Obama has responded to claims of treason made against him by Donald Trump [2].

articles.title: Israeli gunfire and strikes kill at least 25 in Gaza as many of the dead sought aid
articles.description: The article reports on the deaths of at least 25 people in Gaza due to Israeli gunfire and strikes, noting that many of the deceased were seeking aid [1].

articles.title: Germany, UK, France say Gaza humanitarian crisis must end
articles.description: Germany, the UK, and France have jointly stated that the humanitarian crisis in Gaza must come to an end [2].

articles.title: PM Modi departs for home after concluding visit to Maldives
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has concluded his visit to the Maldives after attending the country's Independence Day celebrations as the guest of honor [3].

articles.title: A man accused of stabbing 11 people at a Walmart is in Michigan authorities' custody
articles.description: A man is in custody after a stabbing incident at a Walmart in Michigan where 11 people were wounded [1, 2].

articles.title: Israel announces tactical pauses in fighting in Gaza
articles.description: The Israeli military has begun a âtactical pauseâ in fighting in three areas of Gaza to address a worsening humanitarian situation [2, 3]. Trucks loaded with aid have started to cross from Egypt into Gaza [3].

articles.title: Trump says Japan will invest $550 billion in US
articles.description: Donald Trump stated that Japan would invest $550 billion in the U.S., but it may not be a sure thing [1, 2].
